newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Poh Lian in S$97 mln building works deal.
newsitem.headline: Poh Lian in S$97 mln building works deal.

text.p: Integrated access equipment company Poh Lian Holdings Ltd said on Monday it had won a Singapore $97 million building works contract for a Singapore housing development project.
Poh Lian said in a statement the Regentville project would be its biggest construction contract to date and marked its continued diversification into private sector building works.

"The Regentville project is in line with our strategy of diversification into the construction of private property projects which are targeted to meet the requirements of our customers," said Poh Lian chief executive Tan Eng Khiam.
Tan said the firm would continue to tender for new building projects and was currently negotiating four other private sector contracts.

Regentville is a 15-storey, five-block apartment development, due to be completed in 25 months, and takes to S$213 million the value of construction projects on Poh Lian's books which it expects to complete within the next two to three years.
The statement also said Poh Lian's CME Industries Pte Ltd unit had secured advance orders of about S$1 million for a range of hoists made by Dutch firm HEK Manufacturing BV.
CME was named on Monday as exclusive dealer for the range, the statement said.
